{include "default_salutation"} –

North Carolina lawmakers have just released redistricting maps and announced public hearings on these maps for the state legislative and congressional districts. The public hearings will take place on Monday and Tuesday, October 25-26, giving North Carolinians little notice and time to participate and prepare testimony, including communities of color that have been targeted at every stage of the redistricting process.

So far, many of these proposals divide our communities and erode our community's power – all for politicians' partisan gain. That's why we need you to make your voice heard and hold lawmakers accountable.

Visit our website to sign up to make comments during the redistricting public hearings (there will be virtual and in-person options) on Monday and Tuesday, October 25-26.

Not sure what to say about the maps? Our partner organizations are holding virtual public testimony training sessions this Sunday, October 24, to help people testify on the draft maps ahead of next week's public hearings.

Register for our partners' public testimony training sessions and learn how to draft effective public comments.

This is our last chance to demand better maps, fair representation, and more resources for our communities. The work we do over the next few days will make a difference in our communities over the next decade.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Ann C. Webb
Senior Policy Counsel, {affiliate_name}
